Spinning Juice Fountain.name: Spinning Juice Fountain
Spinning Juice Fountain.descriptionHazard: The enchanted fountain spews large quantities of grape juice as its marble tiers spin with increasing speed, flinging juice in all directions.
Spinning Juice Fountain.disable:
@Check[type:athletics|dc:16|name:Grapple a Tier|traits:hazard,complex,magical,trap,action:grapple] to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a tier and halt its momentum, followed by @Check[type:crafting|dc:14|name:Disable the Pump Mechanism|traits:hazard,complex,magical,trap,action:disable-a-device] or @Check[type:thievery|dc:14|name:Disable the Pump Mechanism|traits:hazard,complex,magical,trap,action:disable-a-device] (while the tier is grabbed) to disable the pump mechanism through the gap that the previous checks left open. Grappling a tier requires 1 action. Each Crafting or Thievery check to disable a tier is a 2-action activity.

The fountain has three tiers, and fully disabling the fountain requires each tier to be disabled. For each disabled tier, the DC's to Grapple or disable another tier decrease by 2. If the creature critically succeeds at a check to disable a tier, it's immediately disabled, regardless of the number of checks that would otherwise be required due to Challenge Point adjustments.
Spinning Juice Fountain.routine: (1 action) The fountain accelerates its spinning, spraying juice 10 feet in all directions on its first turn, 15 feet in all directions on its second turn, and 20 feet in all directions on its third turn. Every square where it sprays juice becomes difficult terrain. At the start of its fourth turn, the fountain breaks, disabling the hazard and flinging juice 25 feet in all directions.

action->Begin to Spin.name: Begin to Spin
action->Begin to Spin.description:
Trigger Safa commands the fountain to start spinning at the beginning of Event 1: Safa's Arrival

Effect The fountain sprays juice in all directions, making every square adjacent to it difficult terrain. The trap rolls initiative.

action->Centrifugal Slam.name: Centrifugal Slam
action->Centrifugal Slam.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} one of the fountain's tiers. Each tier of the fountain has one reaction per round

Effect The heavy, spinning marble has enough sheer force to crush the hands of those trying to stop it. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15|traits:hazard,complex,magical,trap] save before it rolls its check to Grapple the fountain.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its next check to Grapple the fountain.

Success The creature takes no damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning]] damage and takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its next check to Grapple the fountain.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(2d6+3)[bludgeoning]] damage and is flung 10 feet away from the fountain in a random direction, preventing its attempt to Grapple the fountain.

Strong Electric Latch Rune.name: Strong Electric Latch Rune
Strong Electric Latch Rune.descriptionHazard: An invisible rune imprinted on a door latch releases a powerful electric discharge.
Strong Electric Latch Rune.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Scratch Out the Rune|traits:electricity,evocation,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to scratch out the rune without allowing electricity to flow, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 21) to counteract the rune

action->Electrocution.name: Electrocution
action->Electrocution.description:
Trigger A creature grasps the door latch directly or with a tool.

Effect The trap deals @Damage[(3d12+8)[electricity]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true|traits:hazard,trap] save).

Strong Fire Sentry.name: Strong Fire Sentry
Strong Fire Sentry.descriptionHazard: A @Template[type:burst|distance:5] pillar of magical fire travels along a track throughout the room. The pillar emits bright light out to 20 feet.
Strong Fire Sentry.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:23|name:Deactivate Control Panel|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (trained) or @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Deactivate Control Panel|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (trained) once on the control panel deactivates the whole trap, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Deactivate Tracks|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (trained) twice on the track prevents the pillar from moving. Each check requires two actions.
Strong Fire Sentry.reset: The trap deactivates once it no longer detects the presence of creatures in the room.
Strong Fire Sentry.routine: (2 actions) The pillar Strides, following the track in the room. If the trap's track is broken, the pillar can still Stride, but its Speed is only 15 feet. The pillar cannot move at all if the track is destroyed. When the pillar moves, it deals @Damage[(1d10+6)[fire]] damage to any creatures whose space it moves through.
Strong Fire Sentry.stealth: (trained) or @Check[type:perception|dc:18|name:Notice Control Panel|traits:hazard,complex,fire,magical,trap] check to notice the control panel

action->Flaming Circuit.name: Flaming Circuit
action->Flaming Circuit.description:
Trigger Skyreach's defenses are active, and a creature who is not carrying a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gbwr57aT9ou8yKWT]{Wayfinder} enters the room.

Effect A pillar of magical fire surges forth. The hazard rolls initiative.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A sulfuric slime can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->One With the Mud.name: One With the Mud
action->One With the Mud.description:
Trigger The slime takes piercing or slashing damage while touching water or mud

Effect The slime temporarily shrinks in size as part of its body seeps out through its wounds. It thrashes in the nearby sludge, making it more difficult to determine where the boundaries of its body end. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC until the beginning of its next turn.

action->Formation.name: Formation
action->Formation.description: When he's adjacent to at least two other allies, Tadrun gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

action->Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
action->Hunt Prey.description: Tadrun designates a single creature he can see and hear, or one he's Tracking, as his prey. Tadrun gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time Tadrun hits his designated prey in a round, he deals an additional 1d8 precision damage. These effects last until Tadrun uses Hunt Prey again.

action->Mobility.description: When Tascio Strides half his Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Tascio deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r (2d8+5)[healing]]]{2d8+5 Hit Points}.

action->Evasion.description: When Tascio rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

action->Distort Form.description: The temporal echo shifts rapidly between multiple timelines, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. As the nature of this effect leaves the echo's location obvious, it can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak. This effect lasts for 1 minute, or until the echo is dealt any damage.

Thick Pelagastr Tail.name: Thick Pelagastr Tail
Thick Pelagastr Tail.allSavesBonus: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 fee.description: The pelagastr tail can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the pelagastr tail the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

action->Out of Phase.name: Out of Phase
action->Out of Phase.description: The pelagastr tail weakens as the Lodge's connection to reality is reestablished by the Material Failsafe. The first time the failsafe is activated, the pelagastr tail loses the Discordant Diversion reaction. The second time the failsafe is activated, it loses the Constrict ability. The third time the failsafe is activated, the pelagastr tail loses fast healing, takes [[/r {3d8}#damage]]{3d8 damage}, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it leaves the Woodsedge Lodge and returns to the Maelstrom.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Discordant Diversion.name: Discordant Diversion
action->Discordant Diversion.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet attempts to Communicate from Beyond.

Effect A shimmer of distracting chaos flashes out from the pelagastr tail. Unless the triggering creature succeeds at a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save, the activity is disrupted.

action->Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
action->Protean Anatomy.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

action->Inflict Lesser Warpwave.name: Inflict Lesser Warpwave
action->Inflict Lesser Warpwave.description:
The pelagastr tail inflicts a lesser warpwave on a creature within 30 feet (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save to resist).

[[/r 1d8 #Lesser Warpwave Effect]]{Lesser Warpwave Effect}

D8 Lesser Warpwave Effect
1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}(@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure)

5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by filaments of energy

action->Warping Squeeze.name: Warping Squeeze
action->Warping Squeeze.description: Any creature damaged by the pelagastr tail's Constrict ability must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or be subject to a lesser warpwave.

Thomil Bolyrius (3-4).name: Thomil Bolyrius (3-4)
Thomil Bolyrius (3-4).publicNotes:
Troubadours keep alive the traditional songs of their cultural and write original works to commemorate major events.

Performances can serve as entertainment, expressions of beauty, or part of a shared culture.

action->Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
action->Bardic Lore.description: Thomil Bolyrius can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on any subject with a +7 modifier.

Thomil Bolyrius (5-6).name: Thomil Bolyrius (5-6)
Thomil Bolyrius (5-6).publicNotes:
Troubadours keep alive the traditional songs of their cultural and write original works to commemorate major events.

Performances can serve as entertainment, expressions of beauty, or part of a shared culture.

action->Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
action->Bardic Lore.description: Thomil Bolyrius can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on any subject with a +10 modifier.

Thundering Wihsaak.name: Thundering Wihsaak
Thundering Wihsaak.publicNotes:
These gaunt and insectile sahkils torment their foes by focusing on a widespread fear of insects and creeping, crawling vermin. Unlike their more subtle cousins, wihsaaks don't lurk in the periphery and instead directly engage their targets, using their unnerving buzzing to disorient and terrify.

When encountering multiple foes, wihsaaks attempt to spread fear to everyone before slashing at them with their devastating claws.

action->Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
action->Easy to Call.description: A sahkil's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

action->Swarmwalker.name: Swarmwalker
action->Swarmwalker.description: Swarms of animals and other unintelligent creatures instinctively leave a wihsaak alone. A wihsaak is immune to the damage from and effects of swarms with an Intelligence of -5.

action->Droning Distraction.name: Droning Distraction
action->Droning Distraction.description:
Effect The wihsaak beats its wings rapidly, creating a buzzing drone that numbs creatures' minds. Each creature within 100 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save. They are then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is confused for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

action->Skip Between.name: Skip Between
action->Skip Between.description:
The wihsaak moves from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt} except that the effect has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed.

A summoned sakhil can't use Skip Between.

Thundering Wihsaak (Arctic).name: Thundering Wihsaak (Arctic)
Thundering Wihsaak (Arctic).publicNotes:
The monsters are acclimated to the wintery climate of northern Arcadia.

Thundering Wihsaak (Heretical).name: Thundering Wihsaak (Heretical)
Thundering Wihsaak (Heretical).publicNotes:
The monsters have a visceral hatred of good deities and their servants, particularly Arcadia's benevolent couatls.

action->Abjure the Blessings of Vitality.name: Abjure the Blessings of Vitality
action->Abjure the Blessings of Vitality.description: Despite not being undead, this creature gains void healing. Its Strikes deal an additional @Damage[1d6[spirit]] damage to creatures that can cast divine or primal spells.

Thundering Wihsaak (Rifle Mutation).publicNotes:

When encountering multiple foes, wihsaaks attempt to spread fear to everyone before slashing at them with their devastating claws.

action->Cumbersome Mutation.name: Cumbersome Mutation
action->Cumbersome Mutation.description: While a mutated wihsaak's claw rifle is drawn, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against melee Strikes. It can suppress the mutation to stow the antler rifle with a single Interact action; if it does so, it cannot use the weapon again until it re-activates the mutation and draws the weapon with another Interact action.

action->Easy to Call.description: A sahkil's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Tilting Floor.name: Tilting Floor
Tilting Floor.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] to prop up the floor, or @Check[type:crafting|dc:17] (trained) to reinforce subflooring

action->Tilt.name: Tilt
action->Tilt.description:
Trigger A creature moves on the unstable floor

Effect The floor tilts into a steep incline. Any creature on the tilting floor must succeed at either a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20] save or a @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:17|traits:action:balance] {Acrobatics check to Balance} (the creature chooses) or else take @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning]] damage as it slams into the wall.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage. It keeps its footing and can move freely across the floor this round.

Success The creature takes no damage but is somewhat off-balance; the floor is difficult terrain for the creature this round.

Failure The creature slides backward into the wall, taking full damage.

Critical Failure The creature slides backward into the wall with great force, taking double damage.

action->Anguish.name: Anguish
action->Anguish.description: The wail of a timewarped amalgam transfers fragments of the amalgam's pain onto those who hear it. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:17|traits:sonic] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). After attempting this save, a creature is temporarily immune to Anguish for 24 hours.

Tombstone Door.name: Tombstone Door
Tombstone Door.descriptionHazard: A malfunction in the door's opening mechanism has caused unstable magic to pool within it, making it liable to release the sorrows it has collected from all who have mourned their lost homeland at its threshold.
Tombstone Door.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:17] (trained) or @Check[type:deception|dc:20] to coax the door's magic into allowing access; the DC is reduced by 2 if someone in the room has said "Tar Khadurrm" in the last hour.

action->Surge of Sorrow.name: Surge of Sorrow
action->Surge of Sorrow.description:
Trigger A creature touches the door

Effect The last of the door's magic arcs outward. All creatures within @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10 feet} of the door must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour.

Trip Wire.name: Trip Wire
Trip Wire.descriptionHazard: Barbed wire stretches across the passageway at the perfect height to tear into ankles.

action->Snarl.name: Snarl
action->Snarl.description:
Trigger A creature walks into the trip wire

Effect The trip wire snaps free and coils around limbs. The triggering creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 hour.

consumable->Cheetah's Elixir (Lesser).name: Cheetah's Elixir (Lesser)
consumable->Cheetah's Elixir (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a +5 foot status bonus to your Speed for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lNWACCNe9RYgaFxb]{Effect: Cheetah's Elixir (Lesser)}

action->Iron Command.name: Iron Command
action->Iron Command.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages you

Effect The interrogator puts an impertinent foe who dared harm them in their proper place. They command their enemy to kneel before them in obedience. If they dare to refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish. The foe must choose one of the following options.

  • The enemy kneels, dropping @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as a free action.
  • The enemy refuses, and the interrogator deals @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage to it.

In addition, the interrogator's Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra damage until the end of your next turn. You choose whether the damage type is spirit or void each time you use this reaction.

action->Intimidating Strike.name: Intimidating Strike
action->Intimidating Strike.description: The interrogator makes a melee Strike. If they hit and deal damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit.

action->Dooming Bark.name: Dooming Bark
action->Dooming Bark.description:
Any creature within 200 feet of the cu sith that hears its Dooming Bark must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immune to Dooming Bark for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}.

If a creature is already frightened when it fails a save against Dooming Bark, its frightened value increases by 1 and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

A creature in an area that the cu sith can't easily reach-such as a hidden burrow or enclosed building-increases the degree of success of its saving throw against Dooming Bark by one step.

action->Worry Prey.name: Worry Prey
action->Worry Prey.description:
Requirements The cu sith has a Large or smaller creature grabbed in its jaws

Effect The cu sith viciously shakes its prey. The cu sith makes a jaws Strike against the grabbed creature with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. If the cu sith hits, it deals jaws damage, maintains its Grab, and attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} its target of anything it is holding. On a miss, the cu sith releases the creature.

action->Shadow Blend.name: Shadow Blend
action->Shadow Blend.description: The umbral drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. It gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.

action->Shadow Evade.name: Shadow Evade
action->Shadow Evade.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the umbral drake while it is in an area of dim light

Effect The umbral drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] check in order to affect the umbral drake, as if the drake were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} for the triggering attack.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The umbral drake makes one bite Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

action->Shadow Breath.name: Shadow Breath
action->Shadow Breath.description:
An umbral drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]{5-foot-radius burst}. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a [[/r 1d20+12 #Counteract Light]]{+12} counteract modifier.

The umbral drake can't use Shadow Breath again for [[/br 1d6]] rounds.

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The umbral drake Strides or Flies twice.

action->Sap Life.name: Sap Life
action->Sap Life.description: When Uncle Jeb casts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell and damages at least one living creature, he regains Hit Points equal to the spell rank of his harm spell.

Unstable Column (1-2).name: Unstable Column (1-2)
Unstable Column (1-2).descriptionHazard: Plaster crumbles from this column moments before it collapses.
Unstable Column (1-2).disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:16] (trained) to stabilize the column, @Check[type:athletics|dc:19] to push the column back into place

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature steps on the tiles adjacent to the column

Effect The column collapses. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true] save as debris falls on them, which deals @Damage[(2d6+3)[bludgeoning]] damage. The area adjacent to the collapsed column becomes difficult terrain.

Unstable Column (3-4).name: Unstable Column (3-4)
Unstable Column (3-4).descriptionHazard: Plaster crumbles from this column moments before it collapses.
Unstable Column (3-4).disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:18] (trained) to stabilize the column, @Check[type:athletics|dc:21] to push the column back into place

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature steps on the tiles adjacent to the column

Effect The column collapses. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:18|basic:true] save as debris falls on them, which deals @Damage[(2d10+7)[bludgeoning]] damage. The area adjacent to the collapsed column becomes difficult terrain.

Unstable Column (5-6).name: Unstable Column (5-6)
Unstable Column (5-6).descriptionHazard: Plaster crumbles from this column moments before it collapses.
Unstable Column (5-6).disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:22] (trained) to stabilize the column, @Check[type:athletics|dc:25] to push the column back into place

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature steps on the tiles adjacent to the column

Effect The column collapses. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save as debris falls on them, which deals @Damage[(4d8+10)[bludgeoning]] damage. The area adjacent to the collapsed column becomes difficult terrain.

Unstable Skeletal Champion.name: Unstable Skeletal Champion
Unstable Skeletal Champion.publicNotes:
These skeletons retain the cunning they possessed in life.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:15|basic:true] save.

Unstable Skeleton Guard.name: Unstable Skeleton Guard
Unstable Skeleton Guard.publicNotes:
The most common skeletal minions are mere guardians.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

action->Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
action->Explosive Death.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:13|basic:true] save.

action->Bosun's Command.name: Bosun's Command
action->Bosun's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The bosun orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the bosun's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command - Attack Bonus}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yG27Ixwdpxqbrhzf]{Effect: Bosun's Command - Speed Bonus}

action->Pike and Strike.name: Pike and Strike
action->Pike and Strike.description:
The bosun Strikes with their naval pike.

If this Strike hits, the bosun can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the fist Strike.

action->+2 to Will Saves vs. Higher Rank.name: +2 to Will Saves vs. Higher Ranking Iron Ring Members

action->Fanatical Frenzy.name: Fanatical Frenzy
action->Fanatical Frenzy.description:
Requirements The fanatic has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3Wtzyb0ZgkaC7vHY]{Effect: Fanatical Frenzy}

Vengeful Ember Fox.name: Vengeful Ember Fox
Vengeful Ember Fox.publicNotes: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

action->Cloak in Embers.name: Cloak in Embers
action->Cloak in Embers.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.

weapon->Hatchet.name: Hatchet
weapon->Hatchet.description: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Shadowy Ambush.name: Shadowy Ambush
action->Shadowy Ambush.description: When the Onyx Alliance enforcer rolls initiative using Deception or Stealth, they can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} one creature as a free action.

action->Dread Striker.name: Dread Striker
action->Dread Striker.description: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Onyx Alliance enforcer.

action->Shadow Swipe.name: Shadow Swipe
action->Shadow Swipe.description: Effect The Onyx Alliance enforcer makes a melee Strike. If the attack hits, the enforcer Strides. If the enforcer ends this movement in dim light or darkness, they can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.FlM3HvpnsZpCKawG]{Hide: Stealth}.

Veteran Onyx Alliance Scout.name: Veteran Onyx Alliance Scout
Veteran Onyx Alliance Scout.publicNotes:
The people known today as fetchlings are a distinct ancestry descended from generations of humans who became trapped ages ago on the Shadow Plane. No longer human at all, these people, who call themselves kayals, have become monochromatic in coloration, with flesh tones and hair colors varying between white, black, and all shades of gray. Their limbs are lithe and willowy, and their eyes are generally solid yellow, yellow-green, or white, though a rare few have a purple or blue glow.

Fetchlings have developed their own complex societies in the Shadow Plane, often under the tolerance of or in servitude to the strange, malignant creatures there, such as the sinister velstracs or the enigmatic d'ziriaks. While individual fetchlings can be any alignment, they are all survivors in a harsh environment, which leads to a tendency toward pragmatism. Fetchling clothing mimics the regions they dwell in, with drab colors tending toward darker shades. When they trade with humans or other societies on the Material Plane, they often wear masks or concealing clothing to hide their appearance.

Typical fetchling communities are insular and swiftly close ranks in the event of an intruder. Though individual fetchlings don't mind traveling to and blending in with other societies to facilitate trade, they often hide or even react defensively if they have their own visitors. When one considers the nature of the other denizens of the Shadow Plane, however, this tendency to assume the worst of interlopers might make sense to some.

Fetchlings are not as common on the Material Plane; most of those who dwell there are loners by choice who have left their home to seek out adventure elsewhere, exiles who were banished from their homelands, or planar castaways with no ability to return to the Shadow Plane. This last category, the lost and stranded, are the most likely to be found in larger groups. In cities of significant size, one can sometimes even find a small community of a few dozen or more fetchlings living among humans, although they often do so subtly by dyeing their hair, wearing brightly colored clothing, and utilizing layers of makeup to hide their pallid complexions.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

action->Shadow Blending.name: Shadow Blending
action->Shadow Blending.description: When the fetchling scout is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} as a result of dim light, the flat check to target them has a DC of 7, not 5.

action->Shadow Stride.name: Shadow Stride
action->Shadow Stride.description:
Requirements The fetchling is in dim light

Effect The fetchling Strides. They have a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed during this Stride. The DC from shadow blending increases to 11 during this Stride, and the fetchling remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by dim light until the end of the movement, even if they leave dim light during the Stride.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The fetchling scout's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Void Boils.name: Void Boils
Void Boils.descriptionHazard: Tumor-like growths erupt from the isle as it responds to psychic attack, spewing black lightning and fire in every direction.
Void Boils.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:26|name:Reshape the Dream] (trained) to reshape the substance of the dream, or @Check[type:performance|dc:30|name:Invoke Desna's Blessing] (trained) or @Check[type:religion|dc:28|name:Invoke Desna's Blessing] (trained) to invoke Desna's blessing through hymns or prayers. Each check to disable the hazard is a two-action activity; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Void Boils.routine: (1 action) On the hazard's initiative, a boil erupts from the ground and bursts. This blast strikes as many enemies as possible in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] anywhere on the isle, dealing @Damage[4d8[force]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true] or @Check[type:will|dc:24|basic:true], target's choice) to enemies in the area. Aslynn avoids targeting the nightmares with the blast.

action->Awaken.name: Awaken
action->Awaken.description:
Trigger Sarnia's psychic intrusion begins

Effect The hazard rolls initiative.

Volatile Tidal Controls.name: Volatile Tidal Controls
Volatile Tidal Controls.descriptionHazard: Sigils carved into the turquoise sphere atop the altar illuminate. Moments later, a rush of water flows into the hallway.
Volatile Tidal Controls.disable: @Check[type:nature|dc:23] (trained) to neutralize the tidal magic, or @Check[type:survival|dc:26] to predict the changing tides, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:26] (trained) to scratch away the sigils; two total successes are required to disable the trap.
Volatile Tidal Controls.routine:
(1 action) The magic controlling the tides malfunctions, causing the tides to change every few seconds. Water flows rapidly between areas B2 and B4. Each creature in area B2, area B4, or the hallway connecting them must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save as the shifting tides buffet them, dealing @Damage[(2d8+5)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is moved 10 feet along with the water.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is moved 20 feet along with the water.

action->Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
action->Tidal Surge.description:
Trigger A creature touches the altar that contains the tidal control orb

Effect The hazard rolls initiative as water rushes down the hallway. Area B4 becomes flooded with 15 feet of water.

action->Site Bound.name: Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description:
The wailing ghost is bound to the labyrinth and can't stray from its location.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Weeping Moan.name: Weeping Moan
action->Weeping Moan.description: The wailing ghost shakes with a terrible sob, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's Weeping Moan for 1 minute.

Waking Nightmare.name: Waking Nightmare
Waking Nightmare.descriptionHazard: Faceless statues struggle against each other to stay above the black dust.
Waking Nightmare.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:24|name:Convince the Statues] (expert) to urge the statues to work together, @Check[type:intimidation|dc:27|traits:action:coerce|name:Coerce the Statues] (expert) to Coerce the statues away, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:30|name:Oppose Psychic Influence] (trained) to oppose the psychic influence. Each check to disable the haunt is a two-action activity; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Waking Nightmare.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Waking Nightmare.routine: (1 action) On the haunt's initiative, creatures in the area sink deeper into the dust as statues grasp at them. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+9)[mental]]{2d10+9 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:25|basic:true] saving throw). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the haunt take a -1 circumstance penalty to their saving throw.

action->Seize.name: Seize
action->Seize.description:
Trigger A living creature spends 1 round in the area

Effect A whispered shout carries through the air: "I have a face! I have a name! My sisters may be forgotten, but I will reclaim what's mine" Sinking statues desperately grasp at creatures in the area, struggling to stay above the surface. The haunt attempts an [[/r 1d20+18 #Grapple]]{Athletics check (with a +18 modifier)} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} each creature in the area. On a success, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 28). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Waking Terror.name: Waking Terror
Waking Terror.descriptionHazard: Faceless statues struggle against each other to stay above the black dust.
Waking Terror.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:27|name:Convince the Statues] (expert) to urge the statues to work together, @Check[type:intimidation|dc:30|traits:action:coerce|name:Coerce the Statues] (expert) to Coerce the statues away, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:33|name:Oppose Psychic Influence] (trained) to oppose the psychic influence. Each check to disable the haunt is a two-action activity; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Waking Terror.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter.
Waking Terror.routine: (1 action) On the haunt's initiative, creatures in the area sink deeper into the dust as statues grasp at them. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(2d10+13)[mental]]{2d10+13 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:28|basic:true] saving throw). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the haunt take a -1 circumstance penalty to their saving throw.

action->Seize.name: Seize
action->Seize.description:
Trigger A living creature spends 1 round in the area

Effect A whispered shout carries through the air: "I have a face! I have a name! My sisters may be forgotten, but I will reclaim what's mine" Sinking statues desperately grasp at creatures in the area, struggling to stay above the surface. The haunt attempts an [[/r 1d20+21 #Grapple]]{Athletics check (with a +21 modifier)} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} each creature in the area. On a success, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 31). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Wasp Swarm (Arctic).name: Wasp Swarm (Arctic)
Wasp Swarm (Arctic).publicNotes:
The monsters are acclimated to the wintery climate of northern Arcadia.

Wasp nests are made of chewed wood fibers foraged from the surrounding flora, which the wasps make into a material similar to paper. A single wasp nest can house thousands of individuals that emerge as a massive swarm. Most swarms attack only to protect their nest or if otherwise agitated, though druids and other primal enchanters can bend these venomous vermin to their will-to deadly effect.

While the common wasp poses little threat to a hardy adventurer aside from an uncomfortable sting, a large and aggressive swarm of these territorial insects-to say nothing of their oversized kin-can lay low an entire party of heroes. The wasps represented here are of the common variety also known as yellowjackets, but many other sorts of dangerous wasps exist, such as a Garundi variant that swarms in such great numbers that it can decimate entire villages, and the dreaded extraplanar hellwasps, which build their nests within the corpses of their victims.

action->Swarming Stings.name: Swarming Stings
action->Swarming Stings.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save) and is exposed to wasp venom. A successful save negates the poison exposure.

action->Wasp Venom.name: Wasp Venom
action->Wasp Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)

Wasp Swarm (Heretical).name: Wasp Swarm (Heretical)
Wasp Swarm (Heretical).publicNotes:
The monsters have a visceral hatred of good deities and their servants, particularly Arcadia's benevolent couatls.

Wasp nests are made of chewed wood fibers foraged from the surrounding flora, which the wasps make into a material similar to paper. A single wasp nest can house thousands of individuals that emerge as a massive swarm. Most swarms attack only to protect their nest or if otherwise agitated, though druids and other primal enchanters can bend these venomous vermin to their will-to deadly effect.

While the common wasp poses little threat to a hardy adventurer aside from an uncomfortable sting, a large and aggressive swarm of these territorial insects-to say nothing of their oversized kin-can lay low an entire party of heroes. The wasps represented here are of the common variety also known as yellowjackets, but many other sorts of dangerous wasps exist, such as a Garundi variant that swarms in such great numbers that it can decimate entire villages, and the dreaded extraplanar hellwasps, which build their nests within the corpses of their victims.

action->Swarming Stings.name: Swarming Stings
action->Swarming Stings.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save) and is exposed to wasp venom. A successful save negates the poison exposure.

action->Wasp Venom.name: Wasp Venom
action->Wasp Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)

Wasp Swarm (PFS 3-13).publicNotes:

action->Wasp Venom.name: Wasp Venom
action->Wasp Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)

Weak Hell Hound (PFS 3-07).name: Weak Hell Hound (PFS 3-07)
Weak Hell Hound (PFS 3-07).publicNotes: A hell hound's appearance dismisses any doubts as to its infernal origins-flesh the color of burning pitch, teeth as sharp as any fiend's pitchfork, and a shroud of ever-burning hellfire are all trademark features.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.

Weakened Cobbleswarm.name: Weakened Cobbleswarm
Weakened Cobbleswarm.publicNotes:
Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

action->Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet
action->Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (.description:
A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

action->Grasping Bites.name: Grasping Bites
action->Grasping Bites.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[type:athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone.

action->Pummeling Assault.name: Pummeling Assault
action->Pummeling Assault.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

Weeping Carved Mourner.name: Weeping Carved Mourner
Weeping Carved Mourner.descriptionHazard: The carving weeps. Its tears turn to a mist that covers the halls.
Weeping Carved Mourner.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:20] (trained) to recite prayers for the dead, or @Check[type:dwarven-lore|dc:17] to speak the history of Raseri Kanton, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:23] to plug the holes in the carving
Weeping Carved Mourner.reset: The trap resets whenever a creature enters the Labyrinth for the first time.

action->Weep for Raseri Kanton.name: Weep for Raseri Kanton
action->Weep for Raseri Kanton.description:
Trigger A creature looks at the carved mourner

Effect The hallways fill with a thick mist. When the mist first appears, all living creatures in area A take @Damage[2d6[void]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true] save), and all undead creatures regain [[/r 2d6[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. This mist lasts for 1 hour or until the haunt is disabled.

Werebat (PFS 3-13).name: Werebat (PFS 3-13)
Werebat (PFS 3-13).publicNotes:
Werecreatures are humanoids who transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. The fate of these shapechanging creatures derives from an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. The stat blocks in this section reflect werecreatures in their hybrid forms.

Werebats form organized colonies of opportunistic hunters. They aren't shy about transforming creatures to add to their colony, whom they initiate with elaborate social ceremonies and bloody hazing. The curse of the werebat gives them a strong urge to prey upon on weaker, lonely creatures. True werebats are often unusually tall and thin, with angular features. In combat, werebats favor their unarmed attacks because they can't fly while wielding weapons in their wings.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet.name: Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet
action->Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet.description: A werebat can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

action->Wing Thrash.name: Wing Thrash
action->Wing Thrash.description:
Trigger An adjacent enemy damages the werebat

Effect The werebat makes one or two wing Strikes, each against a different adjacent creature.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description: Human with Fist attack for @Damage[(1d4+2)[bludgeoning]] damage and no fly Speed. In hybrid form, their Speed changes to 25 feet and fly 25 feet.

action->Curse of the Werebat.name: Curse of the Werebat
action->Curse of the Werebat.description:
This curse affects only humanoids

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] DC.

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a werebat until dawn. The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

action->Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy
action->Moon Frenzy.description: When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werebat must enter hybrid form and can't Change Shape thereafter. When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werebat returns to human form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

Weretiger (PFS 3-13).name: Weretiger (PFS 3-13)
Weretiger (PFS 3-13).publicNotes:
These ferocious werecreatures stalk prey with the cunning and skill of a true apex predator. Weretigers typically view all life as a potential meal. Powerful nocturnal hunters with excellent senses that help them ambush prey, weretigers are adaptable to an extreme range of environments. However, weretigers living in densely populated cities (potentially as courtesans, assassins, or guild leaders) often struggle to suppress their killer instincts, becoming overwhelmed by the urge to hunt. They prefer to wear loose-fitting clothing and rely on their claws and jaws in a fight.

Werecreatures transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. The doomed fate of these shapechanging creatures derives from an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. The stat blocks in this section reflect werecreatures in their hybrid forms.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The weretiger changes into their animal, human, or hybrid shape; they are presented in their animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance.

In human or hybrid form, the weretiger's size changes to Medium, they lose their Wrestle ability, and their speed decreases to 25 feet. In human form, they also lose their jaws and claw Strikes and gain a melee fist Strike ([[/r {1d20+14} #fist attack]]{+14} for @Damage[(1d4+7)[bludgeoning]] damage).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Curse of the Weretiger.name: Curse of the Weretiger
action->Curse of the Weretiger.description:
This curse affects only humanoids

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21].

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn. The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

action->Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy
action->Moon Frenzy.description: When a full moon appears in the night sky, the weretiger must enter hybrid form and can't Change Shape thereafter. When the moon sets or the sun rises, the weretiger returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

action->Wrestle.name: Wrestle
action->Wrestle.description: The weretiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. A weretiger can only use this ability in animal form.

action->Cold Adaptation.name: Cold Adaptation
action->Cold Adaptation.description: The young arabuk reduces the effects it suffers from cold environments by one step.

action->Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
action->Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair an arabuk's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.

action->Pounce.name: Pounce
action->Pounce.description: The young arabuk Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the arabuk began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

action->Snow Stride.name: Snow Stride
action->Snow Stride.description: The young arabuk ignores difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, and uneven ground from non-magical ice and snow.

Zebub (PFS).name: Zebub (PFS)
Zebub (PFS).publicNotes:
Zebubs serve as Hell's messengers and spies. Their ability to share what they've seen with other creatures makes them especially useful-not only to other devils, but also to mortal conjurers. Some infernal lords unleash them in enormous, horrid swarms upon unsuspecting lands to debase flesh and land alike while collecting secrets the infernal host might later put to use. Zebubs use any opportunity to manipulate weak-willed or easily tempted mortals into serving the zebubs' whims. While arrogant and deceitful, zebubs lack the cunning and confidence of most devils, and thus their schemes often focus on satisfying self-serving or self-destructive ambitions. Zebubs form from the souls of childish and craven mortals, reshaped by the archdevil Baalzebul in the frozen, filthy wastes of Hell's seventh layer, Cocytus.

Each type of devil plays a particular role in Hell's bureaucracies and hierarchies, though some have far more specialized functions than others.
Zebub (PFS).privateNotes: Also in Pathfinder Society Scenario #3-07: The Locked Lodge
Zebub (PFS).allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Infernal Eye.name: Infernal Eye
action->Infernal Eye.description:
The zebub records everything they see, and though they don't remember all observations, they can pass them along to another creature.

The zebub replays 10 minutes of witnessed events to a touched willing creature, which receives the memories in a flash of information. By remaining in contact, the zebub can spend additional 3-action activities to replay more information.

After relaying their visions to another, the zebub can't ever recall those events again.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The zebub's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
